Question
========

From a normally distributed population N(μ,σ^²^) with known variance, I draw I draw a sample of size 10. If with 1% risk I want to do two-sided test whether μ = 0 then the limits of the critical area become:

Answerlist
----------

* ± 2.576
* ± 3.1693
* ± 3.2498
* ± 2.821

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

± 2.576: Correct ± 3.1693: Incorrect ± 3.2498: Incorrect ± 2,821: Incorrect
